en_US.tips1: Tip: Always ensure your connection is secure when accessing banking services.

en_US.total_limit_description: Total number of times this prize can be won (leave empty for unlimited)
en_US.daily_limit_description: Maximum number of times this prize can be won per day (leave empty for unlimited)

en_US.activate_wheel_confirmation: Activating this wheel will set the existing active wheel to draft. Do you want to proceed?
en_US.delete_wheel_confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this wheel?
en_US.delete_wheel_warning: This action cannot be undone. Wheels with spin history cannot be deleted.

en_US.end_date_must_be_valid_date: End date must be a valid date

en_US.user_manual_description: Welcome to the EngageCore User Manual. This comprehensive guide will help you understand and effectively use all modules in the system. Click on any module below to learn more about its features and functionality.
en_US.dashboard_overview_desc: The Dashboard provides a comprehensive overview of your system's key metrics and activities. Monitor active lucky wheels, missions, member statistics, and recent activities all in one place.
en_US.dashboard_feature_stats: Real-time statistics for active wheels, missions, and members
en_US.dashboard_feature_wheels: View active lucky wheel campaigns and their details
en_US.dashboard_feature_missions: Monitor active missions and their completion status
en_US.dashboard_feature_members: Track top active members and recently joined members
en_US.dashboard_step_1: Access the dashboard from the main navigation menu
en_US.dashboard_step_2: Review the statistics cards at the top for quick insights
en_US.dashboard_step_3: Scroll down to see detailed lists of active wheels, missions, and members
en_US.dashboard_note_refresh: Dashboard data refreshes automatically. For real-time updates, refresh the page.
en_US.member_overview_desc: The Member Management module allows you to view, search, and manage all members in the system. You can sync members from external systems, filter by brand, status, and view detailed member information including points balance and tier status.
en_US.member_feature_search: Search members by name, user ID, brand, or status
en_US.member_feature_sync: Sync members from external API systems
en_US.member_feature_view: View comprehensive member details including points, tier, and activity
en_US.member_feature_filter: Filter members by brand, status, and other criteria
en_US.member_step_1: Navigate to Member Management from the sidebar
en_US.member_step_2: Use the search form to filter members by brand, user ID, or status
en_US.member_step_3: Click the Sync button to synchronize members from external systems
en_US.member_step_4: Select a brand and choose whether to save to database during sync
en_US.member_step_5: View member details in the table including points balance, tier, and last activity
en_US.member_note_sync: Member sync connects to external API systems configured in Brand Management. Ensure brand API settings are correct before syncing.
en_US.member_note_brand: Members are associated with brands. Use brand filter to view members for specific brands.
en_US.mission_overview_desc: The Mission Management module enables you to create and manage missions that members can complete to earn rewards. Missions can be deposit-based or accumulative deposit-based, with configurable thresholds and reward amounts.
en_US.mission_feature_create: Create new missions with custom names, descriptions, and reward amounts
en_US.mission_feature_types: Support for deposit and accumulative deposit mission types
en_US.mission_feature_rewards: Configure reward amounts and thresholds for mission completion
en_US.mission_feature_schedule: Set start and end dates for mission campaigns
en_US.mission_step_1: Click Add Mission button to create a new mission
en_US.mission_step_2: Select a brand for the mission
en_US.mission_step_3: Enter mission name, description, and select mission type (deposit or accumulative deposit)
en_US.mission_step_4: Configure threshold amount, threshold time (for deposit type), and reward amount
en_US.mission_step_5: Set start and end dates, upload an image (optional), and set status to active
en_US.mission_note_deposit: Deposit missions require members to make a single deposit meeting the threshold amount within the threshold time period.
en_US.mission_note_accumulate: Accumulative deposit missions track total deposits over time until the threshold amount is reached.
en_US.mission_note_dates: Ensure end date is after start date. Missions outside their date range will not be available to members.
en_US.lucky_wheel_overview_desc: The Lucky Wheel Management module allows you to create and configure lucky wheel campaigns with multiple prizes, probability settings, and spin limitations. Track spin history and manage active wheel campaigns.
en_US.lucky_wheel_feature_create: Create lucky wheel campaigns with custom names and descriptions
en_US.lucky_wheel_feature_prizes: Add multiple prizes with different types (points, vouchers, items)
en_US.lucky_wheel_feature_probability: Configure probability percentages for each prize (must total 100%)
en_US.lucky_wheel_feature_history: View spin history and track member participation
en_US.lucky_wheel_step_1: Click Add Lucky Wheel to create a new wheel campaign
en_US.lucky_wheel_step_2: Select brand, enter name and description, set start and end dates
en_US.lucky_wheel_step_3: Configure max spins per day (0 = unlimited) and cooldown minutes (0 = no cooldown)
en_US.lucky_wheel_step_4: Add prizes by clicking Add Prize, entering prize details, probability, and uploading images
en_US.lucky_wheel_step_5: Ensure total probability equals 100% before saving
en_US.lucky_wheel_step_6: Use View Spin History button to see all spins for a wheel
en_US.lucky_wheel_step_7: Use Clone Wheel button to duplicate an existing wheel with all its settings and prizes
en_US.lucky_wheel_step_8: Use Delete Wheel button to remove a wheel (wheels with spin history cannot be deleted)
en_US.lucky_wheel_note_probability: The sum of all prize probabilities must equal exactly 100%. The system will validate this before saving.
en_US.lucky_wheel_note_spins: Set max spins per day to 0 for unlimited spins, or specify a number to limit daily spins per member.
en_US.lucky_wheel_note_cooldown: Cooldown minutes prevent members from spinning too frequently. Set to 0 to disable cooldown.
en_US.lucky_wheel_note_activation: When activating a wheel, if there is already an active wheel for the same brand, a confirmation dialog will appear. If you proceed, the existing active wheel will automatically be set to draft and the new wheel will become active. Only one wheel can be active per brand at a time.
en_US.lucky_wheel_note_clone: Cloning a wheel creates an exact copy with all prizes, settings, and configurations. The cloned wheel will be set to draft status by default and can be edited independently. This is useful for creating variations of successful wheel campaigns.
en_US.lucky_wheel_note_delete: Wheels can only be deleted if they have no spin history. If a wheel has been used (has spin records), it cannot be deleted to preserve data integrity. Instead, set the wheel to draft status to deactivate it.
en_US.brand_overview_desc: The Brand Management module is essential for configuring brands in the system. Each brand has its own API configuration, currency settings, and sync intervals for external data synchronization.
en_US.brand_feature_create: Create and manage brands with unique names and slugs
en_US.brand_feature_api: Configure external API URLs, access IDs, and tokens for data synchronization
en_US.brand_feature_sync: Set sync intervals to control how often data is synchronized from external systems
en_US.brand_feature_currency: Configure currency for each brand (e.g., MYR, USD)
en_US.brand_step_1: Click Add Brand to create a new brand
en_US.brand_step_2: Enter brand name, slug, description, and external API URL
en_US.brand_step_3: Configure access ID and access token for API authentication
en_US.brand_step_4: Set sync interval (in minutes) and select currency, then set status to active
en_US.brand_note_api: External API configuration is required for member synchronization. Ensure API credentials are correct and the API endpoint is accessible.
en_US.brand_note_sync: Sync interval determines how frequently the system attempts to sync data from external APIs. Lower intervals mean more frequent syncs.
en_US.brand_note_currency: Currency setting affects how monetary values are displayed and processed for this brand.
en_US.user_overview_desc: The User Management module allows administrators to create and manage system users. Users can be assigned roles, granted access to specific brands, and their status can be enabled or disabled.
en_US.user_feature_create: Create new system users with usernames and passwords
en_US.user_feature_roles: Assign roles to users to control their permissions and access levels
en_US.user_feature_brands: Grant users access to specific brands
en_US.user_step_1: Click Add User to create a new system user
en_US.user_step_3: Select a role for the user from the dropdown
en_US.user_step_4: Select brands the user should have access to, then set status to active
en_US.user_note_password: Passwords must be at least 8 characters long. For security, use strong passwords with a mix of letters, numbers, and special characters.
en_US.user_note_roles: User roles determine what permissions a user has. Configure roles in the Role Management module.
en_US.user_note_brands: Users can only access data for brands they are granted access to. This provides multi-tenant isolation.
en_US.role_overview_desc: The Role Management module enables you to create and configure user roles with granular permission settings. Roles control what pages and actions users can access in the system.
en_US.role_feature_create: Create custom roles with specific permission sets
en_US.role_feature_permissions: Configure page-level and action-level permissions for each role
en_US.role_feature_access: Set full access roles that bypass permission checks
en_US.role_step_1: Click Add Role to create a new role
en_US.role_step_2: Enter role name and set status to active
en_US.role_step_3: Configure permissions by selecting pages and actions the role can access
en_US.role_step_4: Save the role. Users assigned this role will inherit these permissions
en_US.role_note_permissions: Permissions are organized by pages and actions. Select specific permissions or enable full access for unrestricted access.
en_US.role_note_full_access: Full access roles have all permissions automatically. These roles cannot be edited and are typically reserved for super administrators.
en_US.role_note_edit: Roles with full access cannot be edited. Only custom roles with specific permissions can be modified.
en_US.membership_overview_desc: The Membership Management module allows you to create and manage membership tiers. Each tier has reward amounts, deposit thresholds, and lucky wheel multipliers that determine member benefits.
en_US.membership_feature_create: Create membership tiers with custom names and sequences
en_US.membership_feature_tiers: Configure multiple tiers with different reward levels
en_US.membership_feature_rewards: Set reward amounts and accumulative deposit target amounts for each tier
en_US.membership_feature_multiplier: Configure lucky wheel multipliers for tier-based spin bonuses
en_US.membership_step_1: Click Add Membership Tier to create a new tier
en_US.membership_step_2: Select brand and enter tier name
en_US.membership_step_3: Configure accumulative deposit target amount and reward amount
en_US.membership_step_4: Set lucky wheel multiplier and sequence number, upload tier image, then save
en_US.membership_note_sequence: Sequence determines the order of tiers. Lower numbers represent higher tiers. Members progress through tiers based on their accumulative deposits.
en_US.membership_note_deposit: Accumulative deposit target amount is the total deposit amount a member must reach to qualify for this tier.
en_US.membership_note_multiplier: Lucky wheel multiplier increases the value of prizes won in lucky wheel spins for members at this tier level.
en_US.claim_overview_desc: The Claim Management module allows you to view and process reward claims from members. Claims can originate from missions, tier upgrades, or manual entries. Process pending claims by linking them to promotions.
en_US.claim_feature_view: View all claims with detailed information including member, amount, source, and status
en_US.claim_feature_process: Process pending claims by selecting promotions and approving rewards
en_US.claim_feature_filter: Filter claims by brand, status, source, and member
en_US.claim_feature_status: Track claim status through pending, approved, rejected, completed, and success states
en_US.claim_step_1: Navigate to Claim Management to view all claims
en_US.claim_step_2: Use filters to find specific claims by brand, status, or source
en_US.claim_step_3: Click the Process Claim button (checkmark icon) for pending claims
en_US.claim_step_4: Select a promotion ID and submit to process the claim and trigger external API reward distribution
en_US.claim_note_pending: Only claims with pending status can be processed. Once processed, claims move through approval and completion stages.
en_US.claim_note_promotion: Promotion ID links the claim to an external promotion system. This triggers the external API to distribute the reward amount.
en_US.claim_note_processing: Processing a claim will send the reward amount to the member through the external API system. Ensure promotion IDs are valid before processing.
en_US.field_reference_description: Detailed explanation of all form fields and their requirements
en_US.no_fields_available: No fields available for this module
en_US.no_notes_available: No additional notes for this module
en_US.related_modules_description: These modules are related to the current module and may be useful to understand together
en_US.dashboard_purpose: The Dashboard serves as the central hub for monitoring system activity, viewing key metrics, and accessing quick insights into active campaigns and member engagement.
en_US.member_purpose: Member Management enables administrators to view, search, filter, and synchronize member data from external systems, providing comprehensive member information and activity tracking.
en_US.mission_purpose: Mission Management allows creation and configuration of reward-based tasks that members can complete to earn points or rewards, driving engagement and member activity.
en_US.lucky_wheel_purpose: Lucky Wheel Management enables creation of gamified spin campaigns with configurable prizes, probabilities, and limitations to enhance member engagement and retention.
en_US.brand_purpose: Brand Management is the foundation for multi-tenant operations, configuring brand-specific settings, API connections, and data synchronization parameters.
en_US.user_purpose: User Management provides administrative control over system users, their roles, brand access, and account status for secure and organized access management.
en_US.role_purpose: Role Management enables fine-grained permission control by creating custom roles with specific page and action permissions, ensuring proper access control across the system.
en_US.membership_purpose: Membership Management defines tier structures with reward levels, deposit thresholds, and multipliers to create a progressive membership system that incentivizes member growth.
en_US.claim_purpose: Claim Management processes and tracks reward claims from members, linking them to external promotion systems for automated reward distribution.
en_US.dashboard_feature_stats_detail: View real-time counts of active wheels, missions, total members, and active members with visual statistics cards.
en_US.dashboard_feature_wheels_detail: Monitor all active lucky wheel campaigns with their start/end dates and biggest prizes in an organized list view.
en_US.dashboard_feature_missions_detail: Track active missions showing completion targets, reward amounts, and current status for quick oversight.
en_US.dashboard_feature_members_detail: See top performing members by mission completion and recently joined members to understand member growth patterns.
en_US.member_feature_search_detail: Search functionality supports filtering by member name, user ID, brand association, and account status for precise member lookup.
en_US.member_feature_sync_detail: Synchronize member data from external API systems configured in Brand Management, with options to save to local database.
en_US.member_feature_view_detail: Comprehensive member view displays points balance, current tier, account status, creation date, and last activity timestamp.
en_US.member_feature_filter_detail: Advanced filtering by brand, status (active/inactive), and custom search terms for efficient member management.
en_US.mission_feature_create_detail: Create custom missions with unique names, descriptions, reward configurations, and scheduling options tailored to engagement goals.
en_US.mission_feature_types_detail: Support for two mission types: single deposit missions with time constraints, and accumulative deposit missions tracking total deposits over time.
en_US.mission_feature_rewards_detail: Configure reward amounts and threshold requirements (amount and time) to define mission completion criteria and member incentives.
en_US.mission_feature_schedule_detail: Set campaign start and end dates to control when missions are available to members, enabling time-limited promotional campaigns.
en_US.lucky_wheel_feature_create_detail: Create wheel campaigns with custom branding, descriptions, date ranges, and spin limitations to control member participation.
en_US.lucky_wheel_feature_prizes_detail: Add unlimited prizes with different types (points, vouchers, physical items), each with custom names, values, and visual representations.
en_US.lucky_wheel_feature_probability_detail: Configure probability percentages for each prize ensuring total equals 100%, with real-time validation and preview capabilities.
en_US.lucky_wheel_feature_history_detail: Track all spin activities including member ID, prize won, timestamp, and campaign details for analytics and auditing purposes.
en_US.brand_feature_create_detail: Create and manage brand entities with unique identifiers, names, slugs, and descriptive information for multi-brand operations.
en_US.brand_feature_api_detail: Configure external API endpoints, authentication credentials (access ID and token), and connection settings for data synchronization.
en_US.brand_feature_sync_detail: Set synchronization intervals in minutes to control how frequently the system pulls data from external APIs, balancing performance and data freshness.
en_US.brand_feature_currency_detail: Define currency for each brand (MYR, USD, SGD, etc.) to ensure proper monetary value display and processing across the system.
en_US.user_feature_create_detail: Create system user accounts with unique usernames, secure passwords, and role assignments for administrative access control.
en_US.user_feature_roles_detail: Assign predefined roles to users which determine their permissions and access levels across different modules and functions.
en_US.user_feature_brands_detail: Grant users access to specific brands, enabling multi-tenant isolation where users can only view and manage data for their assigned brands.
en_US.user_feature_status_detail: Enable or disable user accounts to control system access without deleting user records, maintaining audit trails and historical data.
en_US.role_feature_create_detail: Create custom roles with descriptive names and configure granular permissions for pages and actions within the system.
en_US.role_feature_permissions_detail: Set page-level and action-level permissions allowing fine-grained control over what users can view, create, edit, or delete.
en_US.role_feature_access_detail: Configure full access roles that bypass permission checks, typically reserved for super administrators with unrestricted system access.
en_US.role_feature_status_detail: Activate or deactivate roles to control their availability for assignment, while preserving role configurations for future use.
en_US.membership_feature_create_detail: Create membership tiers with unique names, sequences, and visual representations to establish a progressive membership structure.
en_US.membership_feature_tiers_detail: Configure multiple tiers with different reward levels, deposit thresholds, and benefits to create an engaging progression system.
en_US.membership_feature_rewards_detail: Set reward amounts and accumulative deposit target amounts that determine when members qualify for tier upgrades and associated benefits.
en_US.membership_feature_multiplier_detail: Configure lucky wheel multipliers that increase prize values for members at specific tier levels, enhancing tier benefits and member value.
en_US.claim_feature_view_detail: View comprehensive claim information including member details, reward amounts, source (mission/tier/manual), status, and timestamps.
en_US.claim_feature_process_detail: Process pending claims by selecting promotion IDs that link to external systems, triggering automated reward distribution through APIs.
en_US.claim_feature_filter_detail: Filter claims by brand, status (pending/approved/rejected/completed), source type, and member to efficiently manage claim workflows.
en_US.claim_feature_status_detail: Track claim progression through status stages: pending, approved, rejected, completed, and success, with timestamp tracking for audit purposes.
en_US.member_field_brand_desc: Filter members by their associated brand. Each member belongs to a specific brand for multi-tenant data isolation.
en_US.member_field_brand_validation: Brand selection is optional for search purposes
en_US.member_field_brand_tips: Select a brand to view only members associated with that brand. Leave empty to view all members across all brands.
en_US.member_field_user_id_desc: Search for a specific member by their unique user ID from the external system. This is the primary identifier for members.
en_US.member_field_user_id_validation: User ID must be a valid alphanumeric string
en_US.member_field_user_id_tips: Enter the exact user ID as it appears in the external system. User IDs are case-sensitive.
en_US.member_field_status_desc: Filter members by their account status. Active members can participate in campaigns, while inactive members are temporarily disabled.
en_US.member_field_status_tips: Use status filter to find active or inactive members. Inactive members may have been suspended or deactivated.
en_US.mission_field_brand_desc: Select the brand this mission belongs to. Missions are brand-specific and only available to members of that brand.
en_US.mission_field_brand_tips: Choose the brand that will have access to this mission. Members from other brands will not see this mission.
en_US.mission_field_name_desc: Enter a descriptive name for the mission that clearly communicates its purpose to members (e.g., 'Daily Login Bonus', 'First Deposit Reward').
en_US.mission_field_name_validation: Mission name is required and should be descriptive
en_US.mission_field_name_tips: Use clear, engaging names that motivate members to complete the mission. Avoid technical jargon.
en_US.mission_field_description_desc: Provide a detailed description explaining what members need to do to complete the mission and what rewards they will receive.
en_US.mission_field_description_validation: Description is required and should be informative
en_US.mission_field_description_tips: Include specific requirements, timeframes, and reward details to help members understand the mission clearly.
en_US.mission_field_type_desc: Select the mission type: 'Deposit' requires a single deposit within a time limit, 'Accumulate Deposit' tracks total deposits over time.
en_US.mission_field_type_tips: Choose 'Deposit' for one-time deposit missions with time constraints. Choose 'Accumulate Deposit' for missions tracking cumulative deposits.
en_US.mission_field_threshold_amount_desc: Set the minimum deposit amount required to complete the mission. Members must deposit at least this amount to qualify.
en_US.mission_field_threshold_amount_validatio: Threshold amount must be a positive number greater than 0
en_US.mission_field_threshold_amount_tips: Set realistic threshold amounts based on your member base. Consider average deposit amounts when setting this value.
en_US.mission_field_threshold_time_desc: For deposit-type missions, set the time limit (in hours) within which members must complete the deposit to qualify for the reward.
en_US.mission_field_threshold_time_validation: Threshold time must be a positive number (hours)
en_US.mission_field_threshold_time_tips: Only applicable for 'Deposit' type missions. Set reasonable time limits (e.g., 24 hours) to encourage timely completion.
en_US.mission_field_reward_amount_desc: Define the reward amount (in points or currency) that members will receive upon successful mission completion.
en_US.mission_field_reward_amount_validation: Reward amount must be a positive number
en_US.mission_field_reward_amount_tips: Balance reward amounts to incentivize completion while maintaining profitability. Consider mission difficulty when setting rewards.
en_US.mission_field_start_date_desc: Set the date and time when the mission becomes available to members. Missions are only visible after this date.
en_US.mission_field_start_date_validation: Start date is required and must be before end date
en_US.mission_field_start_date_tips: Plan mission start dates to align with marketing campaigns or promotional periods for maximum impact.
en_US.mission_field_end_date_desc: Set the date and time when the mission expires and is no longer available. Members cannot start new missions after this date.
en_US.mission_field_end_date_validation: End date is required and must be after start date
en_US.mission_field_end_date_tips: Ensure end dates allow sufficient time for members to complete missions. Consider mission complexity when setting end dates.
en_US.mission_field_image_desc: Upload an optional image to visually represent the mission. Images help make missions more engaging and recognizable to members.
en_US.mission_field_image_validation: Image must be in JPG, PNG, or GIF format
en_US.mission_field_image_tips: Use high-quality, relevant images that represent the mission. Recommended size: 800x600px. Images are displayed in member-facing interfaces.
en_US.mission_field_status_desc: Set the mission status to 'Active' to make it available to members, or 'Inactive' to temporarily disable it without deletion.
en_US.mission_field_status_tips: Use 'Inactive' status to pause missions during maintenance or when temporarily disabling campaigns. Active missions are visible to members.
en_US.wheel_field_brand_desc: Select the brand this lucky wheel campaign belongs to. Wheel campaigns are brand-specific.
en_US.wheel_field_brand_tips: Choose the brand that will have access to this wheel. Members from other brands will not see this wheel campaign.
en_US.wheel_field_name_desc: Enter a catchy name for the lucky wheel campaign that will be displayed to members (e.g., 'Weekly Lucky Spin', 'New Year Mega Wheel').
en_US.wheel_field_name_tips: Use engaging, promotional names that create excitement and encourage participation in the wheel campaign.
en_US.wheel_field_description_desc: Provide a description explaining the wheel campaign, prizes available, and any special terms or conditions members should know.
en_US.wheel_field_description_tips: Include information about prize types, campaign duration, and any limitations or special rules for the wheel.
en_US.wheel_field_start_date_desc: Set the date when the wheel campaign becomes active and members can start spinning.
en_US.wheel_field_start_date_validation: Start date is required and must be before end date
en_US.wheel_field_start_date_tips: Coordinate start dates with marketing campaigns for maximum visibility and participation.
en_US.wheel_field_end_date_desc: Set the date when the wheel campaign ends and members can no longer spin.
en_US.wheel_field_end_date_validation: End date is required and must be after start date
en_US.wheel_field_end_date_tips: Ensure end dates align with campaign schedules. Members cannot spin after the end date.
en_US.wheel_field_max_spins_desc: Set the maximum number of spins allowed per member per day. Default is 1. Must be at least 1.
en_US.wheel_field_max_spins_tips: Use spin limits to control campaign costs. Default value is 1. Higher values allow more daily spins per member.
en_US.wheel_field_cooldown_desc: Set the cooldown period (in minutes) between spins for the same member. Set to 0 to disable cooldown.
en_US.wheel_field_cooldown_validation: Must be a non-negative integer (0 = no cooldown)
en_US.wheel_field_cooldown_tips: Cooldown periods prevent spam spinning. Typical values: 0 (no limit), 60 (1 hour), 1440 (24 hours).
en_US.wheel_field_accumulated_deposit_requirem: Set the minimum accumulated deposit amount that members must have to be eligible to spin this wheel. Members who meet this requirement can spin if they have remaining spins available. Leave empty for no deposit requirement.
Must be a non-negative number with up to 2 decimal places (0 or null = no requirement)
1000.00 or leave empty for no requirement

Deposit requirements help ensure that only members who have made sufficient deposits can participate in the wheel. The system checks each member's total accumulated deposit amount against this requirement before allowing spins. Set to 0 or leave empty if you want all eligible members to be able to spin regardless of deposit amount.
en_US.wheel_field_prizes_desc: Configure all prizes available on the wheel. Each prize requires a name, type, value, probability percentage, and optional image.
en_US.wheel_field_prizes_validation: At least one prize is required. Total probability must equal exactly 100%
en_US.wheel_field_prizes_tips: Add prizes with varying values and probabilities. Higher-value prizes should have lower probabilities. Ensure probabilities sum to 100%. Each prize must have a probability greater than 0%.
en_US.brand_field_name_desc: Enter the brand name as it should appear throughout the system. This is the primary identifier for the brand.
en_US.brand_field_name_validation: Brand name is required and must be unique
en_US.brand_field_name_tips: Use clear, professional brand names. This name appears in member-facing interfaces and reports.
en_US.brand_field_slug_desc: Enter a URL-friendly identifier for the brand (lowercase, hyphens instead of spaces). Used in API endpoints and URLs.
en_US.brand_field_slug_validation: Slug is required, must be lowercase with hyphens, and must be unique
en_US.brand_field_slug_tips: Example: 'brand-abc' for 'Brand ABC'. Slugs are used in system URLs and should be permanent once created.
en_US.brand_field_description_desc: Provide an optional description of the brand, its purpose, or any relevant information for administrative reference.
en_US.brand_field_description_tips: Use descriptions for internal notes and documentation. Not visible to members.
en_US.brand_field_api_url_desc: Enter the base URL of the external API system that provides member and transaction data for this brand.
en_US.brand_field_api_url_validation: API URL is required and must be a valid URL format
en_US.brand_field_api_url_tips: Ensure the API URL is accessible and points to the correct endpoint. Test connectivity before saving.
en_US.brand_field_access_id_desc: Enter the access ID (API key or client ID) used for authenticating API requests to the external system.
en_US.brand_field_access_id_tips: Keep access IDs secure. These credentials are used for all API communications with the external system.
en_US.brand_field_access_token_desc: Enter the access token or API secret used for authenticating API requests. This should be kept confidential.
en_US.brand_field_access_token_tips: Treat access tokens as sensitive information. They provide full API access for the brand. Store securely.
en_US.brand_field_sync_interval_desc: Set how often (in minutes) the system should synchronize data from the external API. Lower values mean more frequent syncs.
en_US.brand_field_sync_interval_validation: Sync interval must be a positive integer (minutes)
en_US.brand_field_sync_interval_tips: Balance sync frequency with API rate limits. Typical values: 15 (every 15 min), 60 (hourly), 1440 (daily).
en_US.brand_field_currency_desc: Select the currency used for this brand. All monetary values will be displayed and processed in this currency.
en_US.brand_field_currency_tips: Choose the appropriate currency for the brand's region. This affects all monetary displays and calculations.
en_US.brand_field_status_desc: Set brand status to 'Active' to enable all brand operations, or 'Inactive' to temporarily disable the brand.
en_US.brand_field_status_tips: Inactive brands cannot sync data or be accessed by members. Use for maintenance or temporary suspension.
en_US.user_field_username_desc: Enter a unique username for the system user. This will be used for login authentication.
en_US.user_field_username_validation: Username is required and must be unique
en_US.user_field_username_tips: Use descriptive usernames (e.g., 'admin_john', 'manager_sarah'). Usernames are case-sensitive and cannot be changed after creation.
en_US.user_field_password_desc: Set a secure password for the user account. Minimum 8 characters recommended with mix of letters, numbers, and special characters.
en_US.user_field_password_validation: Password must be at least 8 characters long
en_US.user_field_password_tips: Use strong passwords for security. In edit mode, leave blank to keep existing password, or enter new password to change it.
en_US.user_field_confirm_password_desc: Re-enter the password to confirm it matches. This prevents typing errors when setting passwords.
en_US.user_field_confirm_password_validation: Confirm password must match the password field
en_US.user_field_confirm_password_tips: Always double-check password confirmation. Mismatched passwords will prevent account creation or update.
en_US.user_field_role_desc: Select a role that defines the user's permissions and access levels across the system.
en_US.user_field_role_tips: Roles determine what modules and actions users can access. Configure roles in Role Management before assigning.
en_US.user_field_brand_access_desc: Select one or more brands that this user can access. Users can only view and manage data for their assigned brands.
en_US.user_field_brand_access_validation: At least one brand must be selected
en_US.user_field_brand_access_tips: Multi-brand access allows users to manage multiple brands. Single brand access provides better data isolation.
en_US.user_field_status_desc: Set user account status to 'Active' to enable login, or 'Inactive' to disable access without deleting the account.
en_US.user_field_status_tips: Use 'Inactive' status to temporarily disable user access. User data and history are preserved when inactive.
en_US.role_field_name_desc: Enter a descriptive name for the role that clearly indicates its purpose (e.g., 'Manager', 'Support Staff', 'Viewer').
en_US.role_field_name_validation: Role name is required and should be descriptive
en_US.role_field_name_tips: Use clear role names that indicate the level of access. Role names are displayed in user management and throughout the system.
en_US.role_field_permissions_desc: Select specific pages and actions that users with this role can access. Permissions control all system functionality.
en_US.role_field_permissions_validation: At least one permission must be selected (unless full access is enabled)
en_US.role_field_permissions_tips: Grant only necessary permissions following the principle of least privilege. Review permissions regularly for security.
en_US.role_field_status_desc: Set role status to 'Active' to make it available for assignment, or 'Inactive' to prevent new assignments.
en_US.role_field_status_tips: Inactive roles cannot be assigned to new users but existing assignments remain. Use for deprecated roles.
en_US.membership_field_brand_desc: Select the brand this membership tier belongs to. Tiers are brand-specific and define progression for that brand's members.
en_US.membership_field_brand_tips: Each brand can have its own tier structure. Members progress through tiers based on their brand's tier configuration.
en_US.membership_field_tier_name_desc: Enter a descriptive name for the membership tier (e.g., 'Bronze', 'Silver', 'Gold', 'Platinum').
en_US.membership_field_tier_name_tips: Use tier names that clearly indicate progression level. Names are displayed to members in their account information.
en_US.membership_field_deposit_target_desc: Set the total accumulative deposit amount that members must reach to qualify for this tier.
en_US.membership_field_deposit_target_validati: Deposit target amount must be a positive number
en_US.membership_field_deposit_target_tips: Set progressive deposit targets (e.g., 1000, 5000, 10000) to create meaningful tier progression. Higher tiers should have higher targets.
en_US.membership_field_reward_amount_desc: Define the reward amount members receive when they reach this tier. This is typically a one-time reward upon tier upgrade.
en_US.membership_field_reward_amount_validatio: Reward amount must be a positive number
en_US.membership_field_reward_amount_tips: Balance reward amounts to incentivize tier progression. Higher tiers should offer more valuable rewards.
en_US.membership_field_multiplier_desc: Set the lucky wheel multiplier for this tier. Multipliers increase prize values when members at this tier spin the wheel.
en_US.membership_field_multiplier_validation: Multiplier must be a positive number (typically 1.0 to 3.0)
en_US.membership_field_multiplier_tips: Multipliers enhance tier value. Example: 1.5x means prizes are worth 50% more. Higher tiers should have better multipliers.
en_US.membership_field_sequence_desc: Set the sequence number that determines tier order. Lower numbers represent higher tiers (1 = highest tier).
en_US.membership_field_sequence_validation: Sequence must be a positive integer
en_US.membership_field_sequence_tips: Sequence determines tier hierarchy. Use 1, 2, 3... for tier progression. Lower numbers = higher tier levels.
en_US.membership_field_image_desc: Upload an optional image representing the tier. Images help members visualize their membership level and progression.
en_US.membership_field_image_validation: Image must be in JPG, PNG, or GIF format
en_US.membership_field_image_tips: Use distinctive images for each tier (badges, medals, etc.) to create visual tier differentiation. Recommended: 400x400px.
en_US.membership_field_status_desc: Set tier status to 'Active' to make it available for member progression, or 'Inactive' to temporarily disable it.
en_US.membership_field_status_tips: Inactive tiers cannot be assigned to members. Use for maintenance or when restructuring tier systems.
en_US.claim_field_promotion_id_desc: Select a promotion ID from the external system that will process this claim and distribute the reward to the member.
en_US.claim_field_promotion_id_validation: Promotion ID selection is required for processing claims
en_US.claim_field_promotion_id_tips: Promotion IDs link claims to external reward systems. Ensure the promotion ID is valid and active in the external system before processing.
en_US.lucky_wheel_feature_limits: Set prize total and daily limits to control prize availability
en_US.lucky_wheel_feature_limits_detail: Configure prize total and daily limits for each prize item. Total limits control how many times a prize can be won across all spins, while daily limits control how many times it can be won per day. Set to 0 or null for unlimited. The system automatically checks these limits against spin history before each spin.
en_US.lucky_wheel_note_prize_limits: Prize limits control how many times a prize can be won. Set prize_total_limit to control total redemptions across all spins, and prize_daily_limit to control daily redemptions. Set to 0 or leave empty for unlimited. The system checks these limits against wheel spin history before each spin.
en_US.wheel_field_prize_total_limit_desc: Set the total number of times this prize can be won across all spins in the wheel campaign. Set to 0 or leave empty for unlimited. The system checks this limit against the wheel's spin history before each spin.
en_US.wheel_field_prize_total_limit_validation: Must be a non-negative integer (0 or null = unlimited)
en_US.wheel_field_prize_total_limit_tips: Use total limits to control prize inventory or campaign costs. Once the limit is reached, the prize becomes unavailable for future spins. Set to 0 or leave empty if you want unlimited total redemptions.
en_US.wheel_field_prize_daily_limit_desc: Set the maximum number of times this prize can be won per day across all members. Set to 0 or leave empty for unlimited. The system checks this limit against today's spin history before each spin.
en_US.wheel_field_prize_daily_limit_validation: Must be a non-negative integer (0 or null = unlimited)
en_US.wheel_field_prize_daily_limit_tips: Use daily limits to control daily prize distribution and prevent excessive daily redemptions. The limit resets each day. Set to 0 or leave empty if you want unlimited daily redemptions.
en_US.number_of_spins_to_grant: Number of spins to grant to each selected member
en_US.please_select_at_least_one_member: Please select at least one member
en_US.please_enter_valid_spin_count: Please enter a valid spin count
en_US.search_members: Search by name, username, or email...
en_US.deposit_requirement_description: Minimum accumulated deposit amount required to spin this wheel. Leave empty for no requirement.
en_US.eligible_members_description: This list shows all members who are currently eligible to spin this wheel. Members must have remaining spins and valid eligibility records.
en_US.no_eligible_members: No eligible members found for this wheel
en_US.delete_mission_confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this mission?
